channel.title: Full Disk Encryption (FDE) Emergency Shutdown Feature - Testing Requested
channel.description:
Summary: shut down a workstation immediately when a magic key combo pressed. https://phabricator.whonix.org/T553
What I need:
* Debian user to press: Alt + Printscreen + o -small case letter not the number
Please do not enable the sysctl. I want to check if this feature is effective on a default install
* Qubes user to see if tis works too.

item.title: Full Disk Encryption (FDE) Emergency Shutdown Feature - Testing Requested
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
In T553#10438, @marmarek wrote:

On Qubes it results in kernel message: sysrq: SysRq : This sysrq operation is disabled.
Default value of /proc/sys/kernel/sysrq on Qubes dom0 is 16. Changing to 1 does not work either:

[1363616.422789] sysrq: SysRq : Power Off
[1363616.423456] xenbus: xenbus_dev_shutdown: backend/console/1069/0: Initialising != Connected, skipping
[1363621.427069] xenbus: xenbus_dev_shutdown: backend/vbd/1069/51760 timeout closing device

[1363656.447016] xenbus: xenbus_dev_shutdown: backend/console/1067/0: Initialising != Connected, skipping
[1363661.448050] xenbus: xenbus_dev_shutdown: backend/vbd/1067/51760 timeout closing device
[1363666.451077] xenbus: xenbus_dev_shutdown: backend/vbd/1067/51744 timeout closing device

And finally shutdown after timing out for every VM - 20s per VM. Not good, at least.
Sysrq-c makes dom0 frozen for some time (5s?) and then reboots. Also after changing sysctl setting.

item.title: Full Disk Encryption (FDE) Emergency Shutdown Feature - Testing Requested
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
HulaHoop:

Debian user to press: Alt + Printscreen + o -small case letter not the number

It works! Immediate poweroff. FDE password required on start.

Host: Debian 8 + XFCE4

Works regardless of which window has focus. Tested with focus on Host Terminal and also with focus on a Virtualbox Whonix Workstation VM window.

HulaHoop:

Qubes user to see if tis works too.

No effect: Qubes 3.1 (Fedora 20) + KDE4

Does not work in dom0 window or in a Debian VM.
